originalText.text: It isn’t cheap but they are great at it! Using extensions and Abby, my nail artist was happy to do any design and worked hard to make these fun designs, great place! I’m always looking for a place that can take care of my nails and create designs instead of boring one color and now I found my place in nyc!!

text.text: It isn’t cheap but they are great at it! Using extensions and Abby, my nail artist was happy to do any design and worked hard to make these fun designs, great place! I’m always looking for a place that can take care of my nails and create designs instead of boring one color and now I found my place in nyc!!

originalText.text: Pretty disappointed. It was my first time trying Japanese Gel and I was excited about the long wear time and quality I had heard about. The nail tech was distracted, kept getting up to do other things during the service and go on her phone. She also filed my nail beds and cuticles down to the point where it was painful, making one of my cuticles bleed. I did appreciate that she accommodated my request for a thinner french tip, and tried out different colors until we found one that worked. However, it’s been only a week since my manicure and there are bubbles under the gel, lifting on several fingers, chipping on one nail, and my cuticles are way drier than when I went in. I’m bummed that I spent over $100 on a subpar experience, and a gel manicure that didn’t even last a week.

originalText.text: This review is for Albee, at mellow bar on 120 Sullivan street. She is THE best nail technician in NYC! She takes her time to remove your previous polish and clean your cuticles, each and every step of the manicure is like making art. So therapeutic. I love her work and will be her customer for life!

text.text: This review is for Albee, at mellow bar on 120 Sullivan street. She is THE best nail technician in NYC! She takes her time to remove your previous polish and clean your cuticles, each and every step of the manicure is like making art. So therapeutic. I love her work and will be her customer for life!

originalText.text:
I recently visited Mellow Bar for a gel art manicure and had a very below average experience for the price I paid. I usually go to Vanity Project and am use to their experienced nail artists. I thought I’d try a new place to get my nail art done.

While the location is great and the salon is super clean, I didn’t have the experience I was expecting. While deciding nail art, the nail artist should have told me that the nail art was going to be more expensive than the price I spoke to the technician about on the phone.

Secondly, when I was texted the salon to make sure they could do the nail art design I wanted, she confirmed she could. When I got there, there seemed so be a lot of chaos and confusion. The nail technician who did my nails seemed very stressed about my design and wasn’t confident when doing it.

The result, lots of white patchiness in the nail art design and on one of the nails, the curve wasn’t perfect. I’ve attached images.

In the future, if your nail technician can’t do a design, it’s important to let the client know in advance. I could have saved myself the 2 hours + $$$$.

I’m sure they’re fine for basic manicures but I’d be wary for those that want fine nail art.

originalText.text: I got an Apres Extension from Chen Chen, and I am very much satisfied!  Chen Chen is an extremely meticulous nail technician which is hard to find these days - so many nail technicians rush things (not their fault.  That's how their appointments are scheduled). Chen Chen spent long time on cuticles, checked the length & shape of each nails matches multiple times.  I will definitely be back to get my nails done by Chen Chen again!
